Gilson Ronchi is a postdoctoral researcher at Dutch Institute for Fundamental Energy Research, seconded to the Max-Planck Institute for Plasma Physics in Garching b. München, Germany.
Has experience in design, implementation and management of complex systems, particularly in experimental physics, with emphasis on laser-aided diagnostics in plasma physics, VIS/NIR spectroscopy, and microwave diagnostics. Skilled in programming languages, statistical data analysis, numerical simulation, data acquisition and control systems, electronics.
